newsitem.title: USA: TEXAS/W OKLA FED CATTLE VERY ACTIVE AT $65 - USDA.
newsitem.headline: TEXAS/W OKLA FED CATTLE VERY ACTIVE AT $65 - USDA.

text.p: Confirmed - 57,100. Trade was active in the Panhandle area early Wednesday, USDA said. Slaughter steers and heifers were mostly $1.00 per cwt higher.
Slaughter Steers - Select and Choice 2-3 1150-1300 lbs 65.00, few early 64.00. Select, few Choice 2-3 1150-1250 lbs 64.00-64.50.
Slaughter Heifers - Select and Choice 2-3 1050-1150 lbs 65.00, few early 64.00. Select, few Choice 2-3 1000-1100 lbs 63.00-64.00.

Feedlots reporting good inquiry from buyers. Sales reported on 32,900 slaughter steers and 24,200 heifers; 102,000 head confirmed for the week to date which includes 31,800 formulated cattle to be shipped this week.
Note - all cattle prices based on net weights FOB the feedlot after a 4 percent shrink.
